data.text: @greg_travis @DLeonhardt @nytimes Just because vaccines became available at the same time doesn’t mean the uptake of those vaccines were the same across different states

@greg_travis @PunditPandemic @degs99 @DLeonhardt @nytimes So you committed fraud to give your child a medical procedure that was not recommended, due to an irrational need to stick it to the “anti-Vaxxers”?

Have you stopped to think that maybe you have over rotated on your virtue, and have left rational thought behind?
@greg_travis @PunditPandemic @degs99 @DLeonhardt @nytimes And Greg wished for ‘carditis after he lied. Slap in the face to families like mine. https://t.co/EMaV6gWgz9
@greg_travis @degs99 @PunditPandemic @DLeonhardt @nytimes Did you control for age and preexisting health?

@greg_travis @DLeonhardt @nytimes Hmm…looking at aggregate data and fishing for differences between groups, then pretending to know why they differ and using that to further your agenda.  You should work for @CDCgov!
@greg_travis @PunditPandemic @DLeonhardt @nytimes A few cherry picked pictures don’t change the facts.

@greg_travis @PunditPandemic @DLeonhardt @nytimes So, if you include ZC lockdowns as an NPI, then you can say NPI’s worked at reducing death. 

When all 3 places switched to mask mandates  only, cases took off. It’s a simple and obvious correlation.
